page.title: 08LITTER IN SLOUGH
page.content: The alley next to Baylis Court Secondary School is absolutely covered with litter. Nobody cares about hygiene and people throw their litter about anywhere. This place could be cleaned and made more pleasant. The sort of rubbish that is dumped there is bundles of newspapers, tyres, mattresses, and plastic wrappers. The rubbish is dumped there by people who can not be bothered to go to a waste disposal site. This rubbish is dangerous to domestic animals as well as the public. If there were policemen on patrol and fines were enforced, people would think twice before they threw the litter. The authorities say this costs a lot of money and they don't have money to spare. More litter bins would also be an improvement.
